DocumentQuerySelectorAll.summary:
The method querySelectorAll()
returns a static (not live) representing a list of the
document's elements that match the specified group of selectors.

remarks.para:
-Locating DOM elements using selectors
-Attribute selectors in the CSS
Guide
-Attribute selectors in the MDN Learning Area
- and
-
- and

DocumentQuerySelectorAll.returns:
A non-live containing one object for
each element that matches at least one of the specified selectors or an empty
in case of no matches.
NOTENote: If the specified selectors include a CSS pseudo-element, the returned list
is always empty.
